result.execSummary:
The defendant Devante J. Lumpkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving

superMiscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample; pay surcharge unless previously done. Pay all court costs, fees, surcharges, and restitution surcharge through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
- Defendant is to complete a job training program to enhance his ability to obtain employment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devante J. Lumpkins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Devante J. Lumpkins in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  Defendant Devante J. Lumpkins in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court heard sentencing recommendations.
Sentencing Memorandum reviewed.
No additions, deletions, or corrections made.
Additional statements made by defendant's mother, Stephanie L., and the defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED):   The Court sentenced the defendant to the Wisconsin State Prison for a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving, with credit for ZERO DAYS time served.  
Court ordered 3 YEARS for the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT and 3 YEARS of EXTENDED SUPERVISION under the supervision of the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

Court finds the defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds the defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

 CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* Cooperate and participate with anger management counseling and follow any recommended treatment.
* Seek and maintain employment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $583.00 payable to the victim, Takisha B.    The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge (unless previously done).  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that the court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Defendant is to complete a job training program to enhance his ability to obtain employment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Appeal rights given.

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
CORRECTED Sentencing Memorandum filed by Atty. Danielle Shelton on behalf of the defendant.
Memorandum in Support of Motion to Suppress Photographic Identification received and filed with court.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.   Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing in Branch 2.   Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons. Defendant shall not vote until civil rights are restored.

Defendant Devante J. Lumpkins in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  Defendant Devante J. Lumpkins in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. On motion of the State Court AMENDED Count 1 from Robbery with Threat of Force TO Theft Movable Property under Wisconsin Stats. 943.20(1)(a)(3)(e) a Class G Felony. Parties are prepared to proceed with a Projected Guilty Plea.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Memorandum in Support of Motion to Suppress Photographic Identification received and filed with court.

Attorney Danielle L Shelton in court, defendant Devante J. Lumpkins not in court, in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Shelton requests a motion to suppress identification hearing date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 05-21-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Motion to Suppress Identification Hearing.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Devante J. Lumpkins not in court, in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense just received all requested discovery today.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 04-10-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Scheduling Conference.

Attorney Danielle L Shelton in court, defendant Devante J. Lumpkins not in court, in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense just received new discovery and an offer, therefore, requests to reschedule the scheduling conference.
Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 03-10-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Scheduling Conference.

Defendant Devante J. Lumpkins in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  Defendant Devante J. Lumpkins in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Upon oral motion by the State, Court amends the criminal complaint as to Count 1 to reflect the correction of "City of West Allis" on page 1.  Sworn for the state:Brandon Hurley-West Allis Police Department Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Devante J. Lumpkins in court with attorney Katie Beth Bricco.  Defendant Devante J. Lumpkins in custody.  Gale G Shelton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
